text: The Interdisciplinary Prizes of the Royal Society of Chemistry recognize work at the interface between chemistry and other disciplines. Up to three prizes are awarded annually: Each winner receives £5000 and a medal, and completes a UK lecture tour. ==Winners== Source: {| |- |2018 || Leroy Cronin, Judy Hirst, |- |2017 || , , |- |2016 || , Peter Hore, |- |2015 || , , Anthony Watts |- |2014 || Steven Armes, Sabine Flitsch, |- |2013 || James Barber, Jane Clarke |- |2012 || Hagan Bayley |- |2011 || Carol V.
